intro: Onagra sinuata, commonly known as the zigzag mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, zigzagging stems and heart-shaped leaves with a soft, velvety texture. The plant produces showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy species suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. Botanically, it belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as hibiscus and cotton.
